poem:
**In the Wake of Upcoming Talks**

Across the sea, a bound journey begins,  
Isaac Herzog stepping onto London's stones,  
a chessboard of diplomacy unfurls,  
while clocks tick softly in the wings of change.  
The skyline whispers tales of what-ifs  
as flags unfurl and hopes hang  
on conversations the city keeps—  
unknown strings yet to be strummed.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel’s president to visit London next Thursday for expected talks with ministers Israel’s president will visit London next Thursday just weeks before the UK is expected to recognise the state of Palestine at the UN general assembly, the Guardian understands. Two sources have confirmed Isaac Herzog is expected to meet UK ministers and senior political figures – the first time a senior Israeli leader has been in Britain since the foreign secretary, David Lammy, met". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Israel’s president to visit London next Thursday for expected talks with ministers Israel’s president will visit London next Thursday just weeks before the UK is expected to recognise the state of Palestine at the UN general assembly, the Guardian understands. Two sources have confirmed Isaac Herzog is expected to meet UK ministers and senior political figures – the first time a senior Israeli leader has been in Britain since the foreign secretary, David Lammy, met
